Title: Empirical Insights into the Challenges of Implementing Digital Twins
Authors: Michael Möhring, Barbara Keller, Charlotte-Fé Radowski, Sofia Blessmann, Verena Breimhorst, Kerstin Müthing
Venue: KES Human Centred Intelligent Systems Conference
Abstract summary: The paper discusses general challenges in implementing digital twins, but does not specifically address the challenges of creating digital twins for complex operational roles like DER workers.

Title: Digital Twin in complex operations environments: potential applications and research challenges
Authors: Raziyeh Ghanbarifard, António Almeida, A. Azevedo
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the potential applications and research challenges of using Digital Twin technology in complex operations environments.

Title: Challenges of learning human digital twin: case study of mental wellbeing: Using sensor data and machine learning to create HDT
Authors: Elena Vildjiounaite, Johanna Kallio, J. Kantorovitch, Atte Kinnula, Simão Ferreira, M. Rodrigues, N. Rocha
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the challenges of creating human digital twins, using the example of modeling mental wellbeing of knowledge workers.

Title: Challenges in Developing Digital Twins for Labor-intensive Manufacturing Systems: A Step towards Human-centricity
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the main challenges in developing digital twins for labor-intensive manufacturing systems, which involve human workers.

Title: Towards Human Digital Twins to enhance workers' safety and production system resilience
Authors: Nicola Berti, S. Finco, Mattia Guidolin, Daria Battini
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the architecture of a real-time monitoring system for human digital twins to enhance worker safety and production system resilience, but does not address the main theoretical challenges and limitations.

Title: Human-Focused Digital Twin Applications for Occupational Safety and Health in Workplaces: A Brief Survey and Research Directions
Authors: Jin-Sung Park, Dong-Gu Lee, Jesús A. Jiménez, Sung-Jin Lee, Jun-Woo Kim
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the challenges and limitations in creating and implementing human digital twins for occupational safety and health applications.

Title: Digital Twins About Humans - Design Objectives From Three Projects
Authors: Henri Bomström, Elina Annanperä, Markus Kelanti, Yueqiang Xu, Satu-Marja Mäkelä, Milla Immonen, Pekka Siirtola, Anna Teern, K. Liukkunen, Tero Päivärinta
Venue: Journal of Computing and Information Science in Engineering
Abstract summary: The paper discusses design objectives for incorporating human digital twins in complex systems, highlighting the need to combine machine and human-related aspects.

Title: Design and Use of Human Operator Digital Twins in Industrial Cyber-Physical Systems: Ethical Implications
Abstract summary: The paper discusses the ethical implications of integrating human operators into industrial digital twins, beyond just technical challenges.
